CubeSat Subsystems

Learn about the various integrated components that make our satellite function as a complete system.

System Architecture

Our CubeSat follows a modular architecture with six primary subsystems working in concert to perform mission operations. Each subsystem is designed and developed by a dedicated team of students and faculty members with expertise in the relevant field.

The subsystems are integrated through a common data bus and power distribution system, allowing for efficient communication and resource sharing. This modular approach enables parallel development and testing of individual components while ensuring compatibility within the complete system.

Click on each subsystem below to learn more about its specific functions, team members, and current development status.

CubeSat Subsystems

Our CubeSat is comprised of six main subsystems, each handling critical functions needed for successful operation in space.

Structure

Subsystem

Mechanical design, material selection, and structural analysis to ensure the CubeSat can withstand launch and space conditions.

Learn More

Power

Subsystem

Power generation, storage, and distribution systems to provide electricity to all subsystems throughout the mission.

Learn More

ADCS

Subsystem

Attitude Determination and Control System for satellite orientation and stability in orbit.

Learn More

CDHS

Subsystem

Command and Data Handling System that processes commands, manages data flow, and controls satellite operations.

Learn More

Payload

Subsystem

Scientific instruments and experimental equipment designed to fulfill the CubeSat's mission objectives.

Learn More

Communications

Subsystem

Telecommunications systems for data transmission between the satellite and ground stations on Earth.

Learn More
UMA CubeSat Project

Advancing space technology education and research through the development of CubeSats at the University of Málaga.
